thread.title: Market overview: BofA now sees three BoE rate hikes in 2016
thread.title_full: Market overview: BofA now sees three BoE rate hikes in 2016

title: Market overview: BofA now sees three BoE rate hikes in 2016
text:
18.03 -0.18 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - 1313: Bloomberg reports Bank of America (Swiss: BAC.SW - news ) now sees the MPC (KOSDAQ: 050540.KQ - news ) hiking Bank Rate three times in 2016 and not twice. 1312: Flows into European assets jumped in the past week according to Bank of America to their highest since the so-called 'Bundshock', who cites EPFR data. Inflows to equities hit a historical record of $6bn. 
1311: Shares (Frankfurt: DI6.F - news ) of Amazon.com (NasdaqGS: AMZN - news ) are rocketing 22% following the company's latest results out overnight. Piper Jaffray has upped its target price on the stock to $650 from $520 per share. 
0930: Analysts at Macquarie have lowered their gold price forecasts for 2015 and 2016 to $1,152 and $1,163 per ounce, respectively, from $1,249 and $1,363 beforehand. 
0915: Shares have begun the morning higher led by gains in Vodafone following the telecommunications carrier's latest first quarter service revenue figures. Pearson (Xetra: 858266 - news ) is also seeing some follow-through buying from the previous day. Out on the second-tier index Playtech (LSE: PTEC.L - news ) has gotten a boost from an upgrade out of UBS (NYSEArca: FBGX - news ) while Socgen (Paris: FR0000130809 - news ) has upped its view on Cairn Energy (LSE: CNE.L - news ) 's stock to hold from sell. Front month Brent crude futures have slipped below the $55 per barrel mark for the first time since March. FTSE 100 up 23.86 points to 6,678,72.
